title: Business Live: Friday 4 November - BBC News
summary: new car registrations grow modestly in october .
iag cuts growth forecast on brexit fears .
paris climate change deal comes into force .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's all from the business live page for this week .
join us again on monday for more business news and views .

documents.title: berkshire hathaway underlying profits grow
text: berkshire hathaway , the company that owns stakes in coca-cola co and ibm , reported a 24 % fall in third quarter profits .
the conglomerate , run by famed american investor and billionaire warren buffett , recorded a large one-off gain in the same quarter last year which meant profits fell from $ 9.43bn to $ 7.2bn .
stripping the gain out , operating profit rose 7 % to $ 4.85bn .

documents.title: 'the simpsons ' to break record as longest-running us tv show
text: ay caramba !

`` the simpsons '' has been renewed for two more seasons running until 2019 , twenty-first century fox 's fox broadcasting has said , meaning it will break the record for most episodes of any scripted tv show in us history .
`` the simpsons '' is currently in its 28th season , with just over 600 episodes aired .
by 2019 , it will have outpaced western tv drama `` gunsmoke , '' which finished after 635 episodes in 1975 .
`` take that 'gunsmoke ! '
you lost a race you did n't even know you were running ! , '' homer simpson said in a statement from fox .

documents.title: us heads for 'full employment '
text: the vice chairman of the us federal reserve said that america 's labour market is experiencing a `` powerful recovery '' and claimed that the economy was nearly at `` full employment '' .
stanley fischer was speaking as new data showed that us employers added 161,000 jobs in october and the unemployment rate edged down to 4.9 % .

mr fischer told an international monetary fund economics conference : `` this recovery has been and continues to be powerful in terms of one of [ the fed 's ] two main targets - employment - and it is my view that the labor market is close to full employment . ''
employment and growth forecasts are key factors in the fed deciding to change interest rates .
markets predict that the us central bank may now lift interest rates in december .

documents.title: energy firms announce $ 1bn climate fund
text: the paris climate agreements come into force today , and the bosses of seven big oil companies gathered in london to sign an agreement to work together to cut emissions .
the group - including bp , norway 's statoil , and the saudi oil company aramco - accounts for a fifth of world oil supply , and they will create a $ 1bn fund to boost their climate change efforts .
they will research renewable energy , share technology between member companies and reduce leakages of methane from oil and gas plants - a big cause of global warming .

three of their chief executives - bob dudley of bp , patrick pouyanne of statoil and eldar saetre of statoil - met with the bbc 's business editor simon jack after the signing ceremony to discuss their plans .
he began by asking them why they were signing their agreement today .

documents.title: self-drive delivery van can be 'built in four hours '
text: a self-drive electric delivery van , that could be on uk streets next year , has been unveiled at the wired 2016 conference in london .
the vehicle 's stripped-back design and lightweight materials mean it can be assembled by one person in four hours , the firm behind it claims .
the vehicles will be `` autonomous-ready '' , for when self-drive legislation is in place , the firm said .
the government wants to see self-drive cars on the roads by 2020 .
read more here .

documents.title: s & p 500 falls for ninth session in a row
text: the s & p 500 share index has ended lower for the ninth day in a row , the longest losing streak for the benchmark index in more than 35 years , as investors stayed on edge just ahead of an uncertain us election .

the dow jones industrial average fell 42.39 points , or 0.24 % , to 17,888.28 , the s & p 500 lost 3.48 points , or 0.17 % , to 2,085.18 and the nasdaq composite dropped 12.04 points , or 0.24 % , to 5,046.37 .

documents.title: hack attacks cut internet access in liberia
text: liberia has been repeatedly cut off from the internet by hackers targeting its only link to the global network .
recurrent attacks up to 3 november flooded the cable link with data , making net access intermittent .
researchers said the attacks showed hackers trying different ways to use massive networks of hijacked machines to overwhelm high-value targets .
experts said liberia was attacked by the same group that caused web-wide disruption on 21 october .
read more here .

documents.title: sterling on course for best week since 2009
text: the pound has risen almost a cent to put it on course for its best week against the dollar since october 2009 .
it has clawed back almost 3 percent this week after a ruling from the high court that the government needed parliamentary approval to start the brexit process .

documents.title: north sea oil production 'to surge ' in december says bloomberg
text: north sea oil producers will ship the most crude in four years in december , according to bloomberg , up 10 % month on month to 2.16 million barrels per day .
this represents another challenge to opec as it seeks to curb production , the article says .

documents.title: billionaire hedge fund manager 'treating us election like brexit 2.0 '
text: why this billionaire hedge fund manager is treating election day like brexit 2.0 :
if abedin , muslim brotherhood member regarded as your second daughter ? ? ?
choices you make are beyond unacceptable .

documents.title: saudis 'could raise oil output again ' says reuters
text: long-standing tensions between saudi arabia and iran resurfaced at an opec meeting last week , with with the saudis saying they could raise oil output steeply to bring prices down if iran refuses to limit its supply , the reuters news agency reports .

`` the saudis have threatened to raise their production to 11 million barrels per day and even 12 million barrels per day , bringing oil prices down , and to withdraw from the meeting , '' a source told reuters .
saudi arabia has increased output since 2014 to record highs of around 10.5 million to 10.7 million barrels per day .

documents.title: wall street edges higher
text: us stocks edged higher in afternoon trading , helped by a strong jobs report for october , and keeping the market out of danger of declining for a ninth day straight .
investors continue to focus on the us presidential election .
the dow jones industrial average added 48.54 points , or 0.27 % , rising to 17,979.21 .
the standard & poor 's 500 index rose 8.46 points , or 0.40 % , to 2,097.1 and the nasdaq composite rose 18.88 points , or 0.37 % , to 5,077.14 points .

documents.title: atomic weapons establishment staff to strike
text: hundreds of atomic weapons establishment staff in the unite union are to stage a 24-hour strike on monday as part of a pensions scheme dispute .
unite regional officer bob middleton said :
`` it is a disgrace that the uk government , which is constantly harking on about the importance of the trident programme , is not prepared to resolve this matter . ''

documents.title: pensions advisory service boss stands down after bankruptcy
text: pensions advisory service boss stands down after bankruptcy

documents.title: german prosecutors investigate facebook over hate postings
text: german prosecutors are investigating mark zuckerberg and other facebook executives , a spokesman for the munich prosecutor 's office has said .
the probe follows a complaint alleging the company broke national laws against hate speech and sedition by failing to remove racist postings .
the spokesman declined to provide further details .

german attorney chan-jo jun had filed a complaint with prosecutors in the bavarian city in september and demanded that facebook executives be compelled to comply with anti-hate speech laws by deleting racist or violent postings from its site .

documents.title: marks and spencer store closures expected
text: marks and spencer is expected to announce the closure of a number of stores next week as part of plans to turnaround the business .
a shake up of its international operations is also on the cards .
the new boss , steve rowe , will update the city on the retailer 's latest trading performance on tuesday as well as set out his latest thinking on how to revive m & s 's fortunes .
smaller branches in weaker high streets are understood to bear the brunt of the cuts , which would happen over the course of a few years .
according to sky news , they would number in the `` low dozens '' while other stores would see space reallocated from clothing to its more successful food operations .
a spokesperson for marks and spencer said it did n't comment on rumours or speculation .
author: Emma Simpson
Business correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: betting on trump 'makes perfect sense '
text: it might make you feel grubby , but betting on a trump win makes perfect economic sense
and hopefully less wars too
great minds think alike .
my piece this morning
wrong very wrong he is not fit for potus !
smoking afghan organic it appears
bologne
for billionaires

documents.title: ftse 100 closes down after more trump jitters
text: with five days left until the us election , hillary clinton is still leading in national polling but donald trump appears to have narrowed the gap , particularly in swing states .
investors like certainty , and clinton is seen as likely to maintain the status quo .
trump 's policies are less clear , and the uncertainty has caused jitters in financial markets around the world , inclduing the ftse 100 .
the uk 's blue chip index closed down 1.43 % , or 97.25 points , at 6693.26 .
two us lawmakers on thursday called for an investigation into whether major pharmaceutical firms colluded to set prices for insulin and other diabetes drugs .
the top ftse 100 faller was hikma pharma , down more than 6 % as hsbc highlighted the risk that the company would dragged into the inquiry .

`` it 's uncertainty around the election which is knocking sentiment at the moment , but pharmaceuticals will likely feel the heat whichever way it goes , '' said jasper lawler , market analyst at cmc markets .
paddy power was the top gainer , rising as it benefitted from foreign exchange effects as sterling fell after the brexit referendum .

documents.title: powerful earthquake strikes chile
text: a powerful earthquake has struck in chile near the border with argentina .
preliminary estimate of 6.4 magnitude says the @ twitterid
great report on the uspe james .
very professional .

documents.title: what does air pollution sound like ?
text: what does air pollution sound like ?

documents.title: three 'far-fetched ' visions of the future
text: tech tent - three 'far-fetched ' visions of the future .
read the blog , grab the podcast
author: Rory Cellan-Jones
Technology correspondent

documents.title: why are uk fuel prices rising ?
text: there are two main reasons why the price of petrol and diesel has been going up .
first of all , the cost of crude oil has risen sharply since the start of the year .
in january , a barrel of brent crude was trading below $ 34 per barrel .
by early october the price had risen to nearly $ 54 .
if the price of oil rises , so too does the cost of products made from it - .
although the fact that much of the price we pay at the pump is actually tax means the impact , in percentage terms , is lower than it would otherwise be .
secondly , there 's the steep fall in the value of the pound since the summer .
oil is priced in dollars on international markets , so if the pound falls against the dollar , the amount we pay for oil-based products is going to rise .
in early october the pound fell sharply and the oil price rallied - so it 's really no surprise fuel costs rose .
however , in recent days the cost of crude has fallen back somewhat , and the pound has rallied .
if those trends continue , and it 's a big if , there might be better news for drivers up ahead .
author: Theo Leggett
BBC Business News Reporter

documents.title: taco bell to hire 100,000 staff as part of us expansion
text: taco bell , a unit of fast food giant yum brands , has said it will increase the number of its outlets in the us to 9,000 and create 100,000 jobs by the end of 2022 , as part of a push to reach $ 15bn in sales .
taco bell , which already has about 7,000 restaurants in the us , had revenues of about $ 2bn in 2015 .
the mexican fast food chain employs 40,000 people in us company-owned stores .
taco bell 's us expansion follows plans to grow its international store base to 1,000 restaurants by 2022 .
the company , which has 300 restaurants in international markets , opened its first outlet in brazil in september .
the planned hiring and expansion efforts come after yum brands ' spinoff of its operations in china , the company 's top profit generator , into a separate unit called yum china earlier this week .

documents.title: bombardier global 7000 business jet has test flight , says reuters
text: bombardier 's global 7000 aircraft has had its first test flight over toronto , the reuters news agency reports .
the test flight is a milestone for the long-range business jet , which is considered key to the growth of the company 's corporate plane division .
the new luxury jet is scheduled to enter service in 2018 after being delayed for two years .
pictured is us actor matthew mcconaughey who attended a global 7000 showcase in beverly hills in may .

documents.title: former top gear presenter calls for petrol price regulator
text: former top gear presenter quentin willson , fellow fair fuel campaigner howard cox , and conservative mp charlie elphicke have set up a petition .
calling for mps to debate the creation of an independent petrol-pricing regulator .
mr willson told the bbc business live page that vehicle fuel was one of the very few products uk consumers buy in quantity with little regulation on pricing .
fuel prices seem to go up overnight when crude oil prices rise , but take `` weeks and weeks '' to come down , he said .
the way fuel prices work appears `` obscure and impenetrable '' , he added .

mr willson said that the `` excuse '' that crude oil is priced in dollars , which means fluctuations in the sterling/dollar exchange rate have an impact on petrol prices , does n't explain the time lag in petrol prices falling .
`` it 's just a simple , obvious request , '' he added .
`` all we want is transparency . ''

documents.title: samsung fails to keep a lid on recallsbusiness reporter dearbail jordan writes
text: as if samsung did n't have enough on its plate .
fresh from dealing with its fiery galaxy note 7 smartphones , the south korean company has now had to recall 2.8 million top-loading washing machines in the us .
the reason ?
the top of the machine can detach itself from the machine and cause injury , which so far includes someone whose jaw was broken .
samsung has received nine reports of injuries and 733 notifications of excessive vibration in the washing machines or a detaching top .
the recall involves 34 models of top-load washing machines made between march 2011 and november 2016 .
who knew doing a wash could be so dangerous ?

documents.title: un experts urge brazil to act over mining disaster
text: a group of human rights experts from the united nations is urging the brazilian authorities to address unresolved issues a year on after the collapse of a mining dam .
saturday will mark the first anniversary of the incident in the mines operated by samarco , vale and bhp billiton that left 19 people dead and a track of pollution by mud .
the panel of experts says many of the 6 million people affected by the tragedy are still suffering with various issues , including a potential water contamination of the river doce .
it wants the government to ensure that minimal safety levels are guaranteed for the water being consumed .
last month , prosecutors filed homicide charge against 21 people linked to the firms .
samarco , vale and bhp billiton have set up an institute and agreed to pay compensation and reconstruction of communities for a period of 10 years .
author: Daniel Gallas
BBC South America business correspondent

documents.title: glasgow frigate work to begin next summer
text: work on eight type 26 frigates at shipyards in glasgow to begin in summer 2017
swan hunter tyneside used to build them before blair closed them down .

documents.title: brexit vote derails arriva flotation
text: german railways giant deutsche bahn has shelved plans for a stock market flotation of arriva after britain 's vote to leave the european union , the company 's boss has said .
state-owned deutsche bahn had planned to float up to 45 % of arriva on the london stock exchange , as well as part of its logistics unit schenker .
but chief executive ruediger grube said he will inform directors in december that he can not recommend the initial public offering .
mr grube said that `` unfortunately , the world has changed fundamentally as a result of brexit , '' pointing to the pound 's collapse following the june 23 referendum vote .
he added that , if the share sale went ahead , `` we would be throwing money out of the window , and acting that way would be foolish . ''
arriva is deutsche bahn 's international arm and operates a number of britain 's train and bus services .

documents.title: sterling continues to climbbbc scotland business and economics editor tweets
text: douglas fraser
bbcdouglasf
sterling up 2 us cents in 2 days .
partly explained by # brexit ruling , partly by us election nerves :
sterling up 2 us cents in 2 days .
partly explained by # brexit ruling , partly by us election nerves :
but the footsie and dow and many others down considerably .
partly by how good an investment sterling now is .
my sis is buying as many £ as she can with her oz $

documents.title: passenger numbers fall 10 % at eurostar
text: eurostar has said passenger numbers fell 10 % year on year in the third quarter , while sales were down 8 % .
it blamed the nice terror attack in july for dampening demand , but said numbers were rebounding - particularly because of the weaker pound which had made the uk a more appealing destination .
the operator also said it was pressing ahead with plans for direct rail services between london and amsterdam .
journeys between the cities are due to begin at the end of 2017 .

documents.title: liverpool gets new deepwater port
text: a new £ 400m deepwater port opens in liverpool today .
the owners peel ports want to attract the world 's biggest cargo ships away from southern uk ports and create a new transatlantic hub for uk shipping .
breakfast 's ben thompson had a look around and spoke to asbjorn kops from maersk uk and helen kelly a shipping analyst with lloyds list .
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: us jobs and wages rise in october
text: us employers continued their strong rate of hiring in october while increasing wages .
non farm payrolls were up 161,000 in the month while average hourly earnings rose 0.4 % .
the unemployment rate edged down to 4.9 % .
observers suggested the figures would have little bearing on the us election , but added weight to the expectation of an interest rate hike in december .

documents.title: bmw posts record quarterly profit
text: bmw beat expectations today with a record net profit for the quarter to september .
the german carmaker made earnings of €1.8bn , up 15 % year-on-year , having sold a record 583,000 vehicles in the period .
sales grew to €23.4bn euros , with its bmw , mini and rolls-royce divisions all doing well .
the business added it would continue to invest in research and development in areas like electric and driverless cars .

documents.title: oil price continues to slide
text: oil is headed for its biggest weekly loss in almost 10 months , after opec failed to agree on production quotas for member countries last week - a preliminary step toward finalising an output freeze .
brent crude was trading at around $ 46 a barrel in the early afternoon - .
down from just under $ 51 seven days ago .
harry tchilinguirian , head of commodity markets strategy at bnp paribas sa , told bloomberg : some countries like iraq are already taking an exit from participating in cuts .
what opec may ultimately deliver risks falling short of what is required . ''

documents.title: dyson to open training institute
text: inventor james dyson is to open his own higher education college to tackle skills shortages in uk engineering .
the dyson institute of technology , based at dyson 's research and development campus in wiltshire , will offer engineering degrees alongside `` hands-on experience '' developing dyson products .
students will also earn a salary as they study .
mr dyson said : i know there are many people out there who are as obsessive about engineering as i am - questioning every aspect of a product , how it works , and how it can be better .
therefore why not get stuck into an engineering job straight from school ? ''

documents.title: european shares down on trump victory fears
text: the ftse 100 has fallen still further - a short while ago it was down 1.48 % at 6,690.2 .
as in asia , the prospect of a donald trump victory in the us presidential elections were blamed for the falls .
and it 's not just in london that shares seemed to be reacting negatively .
germany 's dax fell by 1 % and the cac 40 in france fell by 0.7 % .

documents.title: united 's belfast - nyc flight is only regular direct flight
text: us airline united is to stop flights between belfast and new york , despite a £ 9m rescue deal .
the financial assistance was revealed by bbc news ni in august .
most of the money , which was to be given to united over three years , was to come from the stormont executive .
the flight is the only regular direct air link between northern ireland and the us .

documents.title: fujitsu workers to strikebbc industry correspondent tweets
text: up to 300 workers at # fujitsu , manchester to strike for 2 days next week in dispute over pay , pensions & job security - @ twitterid

documents.title: travel firms call for sharm el-sheik flight decision
text: the government has been urged to set a date for the resumption of uk flights to sharm el-sheikh , one year after they were suspended over terrorism fears .
the flight ban to the egyptian red sea resort followed the suspected bombing of a russian airliner on 31 october 2015 , killing all 224 people on board .
a group of more than 30 travel firms is calling for a decision on when direct flights from the uk can resume .
the government said british nationals ' security was its `` top priority '' .
read more here

documents.title: northern ireland sees surge in shoppers
text: there has been a surge in saturday morning shoppers travelling to northern ireland from the republic of ireland since the eu referendum , according to new road traffic figures .
sterling has fallen sharply against the euro since the brexit vote , meaning shoppers from the republic can get much better value in northern shops .
read more here

documents.title: ftse falls further
text: the ftse 100 has fallen further in morning trade .
it now stands at 6,698.72 , that 's a fall of 91.79 points or 1.35 % .
the biggest riser is paddy power betfair , which as we reported earlier , is doing well thanks to strong demand during the euro 2016 football tournament and the weak pound .
its shares are up by 3.79 % so far .
among the top five fallers is ba owner iag which is down by 4.04 % after it its long term earnings forecast because of lackustre demand and the weak pound since the brexit vote .

documents.title: us firms storing more cash offshore
text: us firms have faced criticism for holding so much of their cash offshore , where it is harder to tax - and new research from moody 's claims the problem is n't going away .
the credit ratings agency said us non-financial companies it rates would increase their overall cash holdings to $ 1.77 trillion by the end of 2016 - up from $ 1.68tn year on year .
and most of that money will be held overseas , reaching an estimated $ 1.3tn , up from $ 1.2tn .

`` without tax reform that reduces the negative financial consequences of repatriating money to the us , we expect offshore cash levels to continue increasing , '' said richard lane , a senior vice president at moody 's .

documents.title: clyde type 26 frigate work to begin next summer
text: work on building eight type 26 frigates at clyde shipyards will start next summer , the defence secretary has said .
michael fallon said the date for cutting the first steel would help secure new investment and safeguard hundreds of skilled jobs until 2035 .
he also announced that a contract for two new offshore patrol vessels would be signed shortly .
this will secure jobs before the type 26 frigate work is fully under way , he said .
read more here

documents.title: india 's view of brexitbbc asia business correspondent tweets
text: how is india inc feeling about brexit ahead of the british prime minister theresa may 's visit to india ?
my take :

documents.title: 44 % of firms 'dissatisfied with regional infrastructure '
text: nearly half of firms are dissatisfied with their region 's infrastructure , a cbi/ aecom survey of 728 companies claims .
44 % said the uk 's infrastructure had improved over the past five years , but only a quarter thought it would up in the next five years - down from 43 % in 2015 .
moreover , 64 % fear this will hamper uk competitiveness in decades to come .
carolyn fairbairn , cbi director-general , said : day in , day out , britain 's businesses rely on our roads , railways and runways to move their goods , services and people up and down the country .
it is n't right that nearly one in two firms are dissatisfied with their region 's infrastructure , or that confidence in the future is running low . ''

documents.title: us election trading has 'brexit echo '
text: there is a definite sense we 're heading for a brexit-like event [ with the us election ] .
if trump wins there could be a sharper selloff in risky assets like stocks and the us dollar .
if clinton wins , a rally is on the cards .

ignoring the longer-term implications , there is a strong chance of immediate and significant movements in prices - particularly as we get results in from key swing states back in june the pound plunged 5 % in a matter of seconds when sunderland voted heavily for leave .
we could see similar gyrations in a broader range of markets , particularly if volumes are down overnight .

documents.title: a quarter of 20-34 year-olds 'living with parents '
text: ons data has shown that in 2016 , around 25 % of young adults aged 20 to 34 were living with their parents , up from 21 % in 1996 .
the proportion has fallen slightly over the last two years , though .
young males were more likely than young females to be living with their parents in 2016 , at 31 % versus 20 % .

the ons said : `` larger numbers of young adults tending to stay at home for longer may be explained by them staying in education and training for longer , delaying leaving the parental home as they formalise relationships and have children at older ages and also as it has become more expensive to rent or buy a home . ''

documents.title: 'cohabiting couple families ' grew fastest since 1996
text: pamela cobb from our population statistics division comments on today 's family and households statistical release

documents.title: stay at home generation ? office for national statistics tweets
text: 1 in 4 young adults aged 20 to 34 were living with their parents in the uk in 2016 , an increase from 1 in 5 in 1996

documents.title: asia shares down on us election jitters
text: shares across most of asia closed lower on friday , led by a sharp fall in tokyo , something analysts put down to jitters over the outcome of next week 's us election .
japan 's nikkei 225 index lost 1.3 % to end the week at 16,906 points .
shanghai 's composite index slipped 0.1 % to 3,125.32 while hong kong 's hang seng gave up earlier gains to fall 0.2 % .
elsewhere south korea 's kospi lost 0.1 % .
while australia 's asx 200 shed 0.9 % .

documents.title: low income households will be 'hit very hard ' by rising prices
text: on 5 live breakfast .
they had a follow up the earlier interview with bank of england deputy governor ben broadbent .
they talked to john glen , an economist from cranfield school of management .
he said a `` significant proportion '' of people will see their spending power coming under `` severe pressure '' as inflaiton rises .

`` so whilst the deputy governor is right to say at the average people are not going to be impacted that much , if you earn £ 27,000 a year , the fact that prices are going up at 3 % and your income is only going up at 1.5 % is probably something you can live at .

`` but there are 5.2 million households in the uk who earn below £ 17,000 a year , in other words below that level of income which the joseph rowntree foundation feel will allow you to have a minimum acceptable standard of living , and it 's that segment of our population that are going to be hit very hard , '' he added .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: luxury watch sales plummet at richemont
text: revenue at swiss luxury goods firm richemont plunged in the first half of the year , with sales of high-end watches doing particularly badly .
the company , which is behind brands such as cartier and piaget , saw sales fall by 13 % to €5.1bn and profit 51 % to €540m .
demand for its watch brands - such as iwc , vacheron constantin and baume & mercier - slowed 18 % in europe and 8 % in asia pacific , its biggest market .
but it said the uk `` enjoyed double digit growth rates in sales following the eu referendum '' , as the weak pound cut the cost of luxury goods for tourists .

documents.title: new car registrations up 'modestly '
text: new car registrations grew `` modestly '' last month .
according to the latest figures from the society of motor manufacturers and traders , 180,168 new cars were registered last month - a rise of 1.4 % .
fleet cars saw the strongest performance , with registrations up by 4.2 % , but registrations to private buyers fell by 1.1 % ..
the smmt that was because the market was stabilising after a `` lengthy period of growth '' .
`` september 's number plate change is always a hard act to follow so the market 's growth in october , albeit moderate , is welcome news , '' said smmt chief executive , mike hawes .

`` low interest rates , affordable finance packages and a range of exciting new models helped attract buyers into showrooms and we now look to government to ensure consumer and business confidence remains buoyant . ''
so far this year registrations are up by 2. % % to 2,330,663 cars .

documents.title: british airways-owner cuts outlook on brexit
text: british airways owner iag has lowered its long-term earnings forecast and curbed its spending plans , due to lacklustre demand and the weak pound since the brexit vote .
it said earnings before interest , tax , depreciation , amortisation and aircraft rental would average €5.3bn ( £ 4.7bn ) in 2016-2020 , down from a previous forecast of €5.6bn .
it added capacity would now grow by 3 % annually during the period , compared with 3-4 % , while capital spending slipped from €2.5bn to €1.7bn .
it is the firm 's second downgrade since the uk voted to leave the european union in june .

documents.title: paddy power 'sweating ' as trump odds improve
text: paddy power betfair says it is `` sweating '' over the us election result after donald trump 's odds improved significantly .
the firm called the race for hillary clinton last month and paid out over $ 1m early to customers earlier as a marketing ploy .

however , the republican candidate has seen his odds slashed from 5/1 to 9/4 ( a 30.7 % chance of winning ) following the fbi 's renewed investigation into mrs clinton 's private email server and a flood of bets .
over the same period mrs clinton 's odds have lengthened from 2/9 to 4/11 .

documents.title: commerzbank reports better than expected loss
text: germany 's second biggest bank commerzbank has reported abetter than expectednet loss of €288m ( £ 256.45 ) in the third quarter .
it 's says it will make a small profit for the year as a whole .
commerzbank has been hit by restructuring costs and the impact of low interest rates coupled with weak loan demand from german companies .
the bank said in september it would cut more than a fifth of its workforce and suspend its dividend in an effort to tackle the weak profits and a shift to online banking .
it warned at the time that the shake up would hit third quarter earnings .

documents.title: china to censor live-streaming firms
text: firms like facebook and periscope are embracing live streaming , but will struggle to promote such services in china .
according to chinese state media , the government will `` censor content before releasing it '' , banning streams which `` undermine national security [ and ] destabilise society '' .
online streaming has grown rapidly in china and the sector is worth an estimated $ 1.4bn , often involving young women who sing and chat in exchange for gifts .
the regulations , which go into effect in december , put the onus on providers to censor their content before releasing it .

documents.title: workers being 'priced out of justice '
text: frances o'grady of the tuc has been talking about the fall in employment tribunal cases since fees were introduced in 2013 .
`` we are saying those fees should be scrapped because people re being priced out of justice , '' she told today .
`` taxpayers should fund a proper justice system we should n't have in many cases very low paid workers having to find up to £ 1,200 just to get fair treatment . ''
she adds that vexatious claims are `` very rare , and it seems very strange to administer collective punishment on the basis that we 're told there are a handful of vexatious claims '' .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: bank forecasts 'revised as news comes in '
text: the bank of england 's deputy governor , ben broadbent , has also been talking to the today programme .
he says the bank changed its growth forecasts yesterday based on `` stronger near-term momentum '' in the economy - but that does not mean it got it wrong back in august .
`` it is always the case that forecasts are proved wrong in one direction or another , that is in the nature of forecasts .
`` it is always the case that we have to revise our view as news comes in that is why we have 'fan charts ' with all of our forecasts which illustrate the range of uncertainties . ''
as for suggestions mr broadbent could succeed mark carney as governor of the bank in 2019 , he says : `` that 's three years away , and i have n't even thought about it . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: us election 'impacting global markets '
text: asian equities opened in red early friday as the s & p 500 logged its longest run of declines since 2008 amid concerns over us presidential elections .

voting polls are single handedly the biggest market moving gauge , and if they continue to show a close race to the white house , expect [ market ] volatility to soar with very few assets to hedge against a trump win .

average polls are indicating that trump managed to close the gap significantly in the past couple of days with clinton 's lead currently standing below 2 % ; the lower her lead goes the higher volatility will soar .

documents.title: ftse opens down while pound is flat
text: the ftse 100 has opened down by 0.69 % or 47.17 points at 6,743.34 .
yesterday it closed down 0.8 % , following a high court ruling on article 50 meaning the government would have to seek parliamentary approval to trigger the brexit process .
the government plans to appeal the decision .
the pound is little moved against the dollar - trading down 0.04 % at $ 1.2470 .
against the euro it is up 0.11 % at €1.1234 .

documents.title: sudan hikes fuel price by 30 %
text: the authorities in sudan have increased the cost of fuel by about 30 % in response to a growing economic crisis in the country , reports bbc world service .
it 's been hit by lower oil prices and international sanctions , as well as the independence of south sudan , home to much of the oil reserves formerly claimed by the capital khartoum .
the last time the sudanese government cut fuel subsidies earlier this year , there were street protests ( when prices soared by 60 % .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: will pm govern for 'ordinary working people'bbc industry correspondent tweets
text: tuc 's @ twitterid says scrapping tribunal fees first test of whether theresa may will govern for ordinary working people .
@ twitterid

documents.title: new rail franchise to run west coast and hs2
text: the department for transport has announced the creation of a new rail franchise which will combine the current inter city west coast services with the development and introduction of high speed 2 services ( hs2 ) .
called the west coast partnership , the new franchise will be responsible for services on both the west coast main line from 2019 and designing and running the initial high speed services from 2026 .
the west coast main line is currently operated by virgin trains .

the dft says the franchise , which will run for the first three to five years of operation of hs2 , is `` the first step in attracting a world-class bidding group to develop and enhance the service for west coast passengers and pave the way for the introduction of hs2 services in the future '' .

documents.title: broadbent : do n't exaggerate debt risk
text: on wake up to money ben broadbent was asked about the impact of any potential rise in interest rates on household debt .
he said it was n't the case that household debt had been rising , in fact since the financial crisis the ratio of household debt to income had been falling .
`` one must remember where the overall level of interest rates is .

we 're not talking about rates going back to anything like the levels - in the foreseeable future - that prevailed before the crisis and so any reasonable projections of the overall burden of household interest payments relative to their incomes is likely to be materially lower than was the case several years ago .

`` one should n't exaggerate the risk around that and certainly it 's the case that both the level of debt and any likely level of interest rates , it seems to me , are going to be much lower than before the crisis , '' he added .

documents.title: sales surge at paddy power betfair
text: paddy power betfair had a stonking third quarter , thanks to strong demand during the euro 2016 football tournament and the weak pound .
in the three months to 30 september , sales shot up by 25 % to £ 404m , although by just 15 % in constant currency terms .
underlying earnings before interest , tax , depreciation and amortisation ( ebitda ) jumped by 53 % to £ 113m .
the recently merged firm revised its full-year profit guidance upwards to £ 390-405m .

documents.title: workers 'priced out ' of discrimination claims
text: thousands of workers are being priced out of challenging discrimination or unfair dismissal , according to a trade union body .
fewer people are taking claims to an employment tribunal because of fees of up to £ 1,200 , the tuc said .
it found that the number of workers filing such cases had fallen from 16,000 a month to 7,000 since the fees were introduced in 2013 .
this included a large reduction in cases about sexism , racism and disability .
read more

documents.title: 2017 will be a 'big year of change '
text: john timpson , chairman of shoe repair and key cutting chain timpson , came out for brexit before the referendum .
he says he is still positive about the vote to leave but says 2017 is going to be a `` big year of change '' .
`` i do n't think people realise how much prices are going to rise on the high street [ through inflation ] , '' he tells the today programme .
the national living wage has also pushed up labour costs , and mr timpson says he will have to boost sales by 3 % to cover his costs .
however , he believes europe will eventually choose to support the uk economy , as it will be in its own interests .

documents.title: dalian wanda continues hollywood spree
text: a genuine reason for getting a of george clooney on the live page today - though the focus is actually the thing he 's clutching in his left hand .
and that 's because .
wang jianlin - china 's richest man - has continued his hollywood shopping spree - snapping up the company that runs the golden globe awards .
his firm , dalian wanda , is paying $ 1bn ( £ 800m ) for dick clark productions that also produces the miss america beauty pageant and the billboard music awards .
the chinese conglomerate already controls the us 's second largest cinema chain , amc , as well as legendary entertainment , co-producer of hit films including godzilla and the dark knight rises .
but some us politicians are worried about its expansion - citing the potential for influencing the us film and media industry , be that through pro-chinese propaganda or censorship .
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: can oil firms adapt to paris climate deal ?
text: the paris climate change deal signed last year comes into play today , and businesses are gearing up for it .
but can our big oil and gas firms do anything meaningful to reduce their emissions ?
frances way of ngo the carbon disclosure project tells the today programme that they can .

`` they can diversify by investing in or acquiring renewables , they can focus on petro-chemicals , they can do a managed decline and stop getting new reserves they can invest in carbon capture and storage , '' she says .
however , while european companies will be `` more engaged '' in trying some of these options , us ones could drag their heels , she says .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: mpc expects uk productivity to rise faster
text: more from ben broadbent bank of england deputy governor who was wake up to money .
economic growth had been stronger since the referendum than the mpc predicted at the time , he admitted .

but on productivity growth , which was the `` most important single determinant of living standards over time '' , he said the mpc would continue to expect productivity to grow faster for the next three years.than it had over the last six years , since the financial crisis
he insisted the mpc had never forecast a recession in the event of a brexit vote .
the dominant thing in the last three months he said had been the additional fall in sterling .
that had been the biggest single influence on the mpc 's forecast of a tripling in the level of inflation over the next couple of years .
however , `` one should n't exaggerate the weakness built into this forecast , '' he said .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: bank will hold interest rates 'low for longer '
text: alan higgins of coutts has been reflecting on why the bank of england revised its growth and inflation forecasts upwards yesterday .
he tells radio 4 that consumers are feeling confident and the `` fundamentals '' in the uk are strong .
`` we 've seen strong consumption because we 've got a very low unemployment rate and we have real wage growth . ''
he accepts the financial services are feeling worried , but says an interest rate rise is `` years away '' .
they would need a period of robust growth and high inflation to increase them , he adds .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: emphasise the positive ?
text: as promised , we 've got more on yesterday 's inflation report from the monetary policy committee of the bank of england .
ben broadbent , the deputy governor of the bank , was on wake up to money and made every effort to play down the negative aspects of the mpc 's economic forecasts .
the committee had been expecting inflation to rise for some time , he said , for reasons unconnected to the referendum .
he pointed to the fact that the mpc expects real incomes to continue rising for `` most people '' .
there was , however , a risk unemployment will go up `` a bit '' , but nothing like in an economic recession .
`` one should n't exaggerate the severity of this forecast . ''
he said .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: starbucks looks for china caffeine hit
text: starbucks boss howard schultz has said expansion in china will secure its future for `` decades to come '' .
while the world 's biggest coffee chain still makes most of its profit in the us , mr schultz said its chinese stores were the most efficient and lucrative .
it comes as the world 's largest coffee shop chain said it posted its `` most profitable quarter - capping off the most profitable year '' .
operating profit rose 16 % to $ 4.2bn ( £ 3.4bn ) for the year .
last month , starbucks announced plans to more than double its stores in china to 5,000 by 2021

documents.title: any port bbc business presenter tweets
text: the world 's biggest container vessels can now dock in liverpool with the opening of the port 's new £ 400m terminal , three years after the project was started .
the deep sea terminal liverpool two facility means large container lines can now choose liverpool as a destination over southern ports such as felixstowe for the first time .
ben thompson is there
good morning from liverpool 's £ 400m new port , designed to attract new 'megaships ' to the north west .
will show you around on @ twitterid
morning ben sorry about the weather
blimey !
you really do get around , ben .

documents.title: takata us bankruptcy reports
text: takata shares have taken a hit on the tokyo stock exchange after reports suggested its us unit was preparing to file for bankruptcy .

the japanese car parts supplier though said it `` has not made any decision nor has facts to be disclosed concerning this matter '' and said there was no new decision since a similar news report last month .

when the nikkei opened , takata shares were suspended in early trade and dropped almost 6 % when it eventually did trade , however , it has managed to regain some ground since then , to close 1.5 % down .
takata has been hit by a huge recall of faulty and potentially deadly airbags used worldwide by carmakers .

documents.title: air france-klm goes low-cost
text: air france-klm is creating a more `` competitive '' long-haul airline to woo customers back from the gulf carriers .
company chief jean-marc janaillac , unveiled the plan , saying the firm is `` battling on all fronts '' .
the new brand does not have a name yet , but air france plans for it to offer both economy and business travel on new and reopened routes .
to compete with lower-cost rivals like emirates , etihad or qatar , its pilots and cabin crew will be employed differently to the main company .

documents.title: asian stocks remain nervous about us
text: shares across asia remain nervous about next weeks election in the us .
in japan , the nikkei 225 is down another 1.6 % .
the uncertainty over the hillary-trump battle pushed the yen higher which as usual is bad news for the country 's big exporters .
chinese markets in shanghai and hong kong were flat while south korea 's kospi is down by 0.2 % .
in australia , the asx 200 wrapped trading 0.9 % lower .

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to the friday 's business live .
we 'll be getting more reaction to yesterday 's news from the monetary policy committee of the bank of england that it was now forecasting a near tripling in inflation rates .
coming up later we 'll have some uk car industry sales figures .
then we 'll be looking out for the latest jobs data from the us .
do stay with us for all the news and reaction .
